definition: to give up completely or leave behind
contexts: The scientists had to abandon their research due to lack of funding.
She abandoned her plan to travel abroad.

definition: existing in thought or as an idea but not having a physical reality
contexts: The concept of justice is abstract.
Abstract art doesn't represent real objects.

definition: to provide space for or to adapt to
contexts: We need to accommodate different learning styles.
She accumulated wealth over many years.
She achieved her goal of running a marathon.

definition: to buy or obtain for oneself
contexts: The company plans to acquire new technology.

definition: satisfactory or acceptable in quality or quantity
contexts: The salary is adequate for our needs.
She has adequate experience for the job.
The library is adjacent to the cafeteria.

definition: to change something slightly to make it more suitable
contexts: She had to adjust to the new environment.

definition: the process of organizing and managing
contexts: The school administration made new policies.
The doctor advocates a healthy lifestyle.

definition: a set of rules to solve a problem
contexts: The search algorithm is very efficient.
Solar energy is an alternative to fossil fuels.

definition: having more than one possible meaning

contexts: The annual meeting is in December.
The company anticipates growth next year.
The solution is apparent to everyone.

definition: suitable or proper for a particular situation
contexts: Wear appropriate clothing for the weather.
This is not an appropriate time to discuss it.

definition: close to the exact amount or time
contexts: Can you give me an approximate time?

definition: based on random choice rather than reason
a particular part or feature of something
contexts: This is an important aspect of the problem.

definition: to evaluate or judge the value of something
contexts: We need to assess the damage.

definition: to give a task or role to someone
contexts: He was assigned to the marketing team.
Can you assist me with this task?

definition: to suppose something is true without proof
contexts: I assume you're coming to the meeting.

definition: to tell someone confidently that something is true
contexts: I assure you that everything is fine.
The doctor assured her about the test results.

definition: to fasten or connect one thing to another
contexts: Please attach the document to your email.
The price tag is attached to the shirt.
She attained her degree with honors.
The company attained its sales goals.

definition: a quality or characteristic of someone or something
contexts: Patience is an important attribute for teachers.
The car's main attribute is fuel efficiency.

definition: the power or right to give orders and make decisions
contexts: The manager has authority over the team.
She spoke with authority on the subject.

definition: able to be used or obtained
contexts: The product is available in stores.
She's not available for meetings today.

definition: having knowledge or perception of something
contexts: Are you aware of the new policy?
She was aware that someone was watching.

definition: an advantage or profit gained from something
contexts: The new system will benefit all employees.

definition: prejudice in favor of or against something
contexts: The judge showed bias toward the defendant.

definition: the maximum amount that something can contain or produce
contexts: The stadium has a capacity of 50,000.
She has the capacity to learn quickly.

definition: a class or division of things with shared characteristics
contexts: This falls into a different category.

definition: a difficult task that tests ability
contexts: Learning a new language is a challenge.

definition: a fact or condition connected with an event
contexts: Under the circumstances, we had no choice.
The circumstances of his death were suspicious.

definition: to make something clear or easier to understand
judged over time to be of the highest quality
contexts: She wore a classic black dress.
She discussed the project with her colleagues.
My colleague will help with the presentation.
The ceremony will commence at 10 AM.

definition: an instruction or command to do something
contexts: The artist received a commission for a painting.
He earns a commission on each sale.

definition: to pledge or bind to a certain course
contexts: She committed to finishing the project.

definition: a raw material or primary product
a group of people living in the same place
contexts: She's active in the local community.
The scientific community supports this theory.

definition: able to exist or work together without conflict
contexts: The software is compatible with Windows.

definition: to give something, typically money, as payment
contexts: The company will compensate for the delay.
She was compensated for her overtime work.
She compiled data for her research.
The report compiles information from various sources.
The wine complements the meal perfectly.
The problem is more complex than it appears.

definition: a part or element of a larger whole
contexts: Each component serves a specific function.

definition: complete and including everything that is necessary
to consist of or be made up of
to calculate or work out mathematically
contexts: The computer can compute complex equations.

definition: to form an idea or plan in the mind
contexts: It's hard to conceive such a large number.

definition: to focus attention or effort on something
contexts: The factory concentrates production in one area.

definition: an abstract idea or general notion
contexts: The concept of democracy is complex.
She explained the basic concepts clearly.

definition: to bring or come to an end
contexts: From the evidence, we can conclude that...

definition: existing or happening at the same time

contexts: The orchestra conductor led the performance.

definition: to have discussions or to grant something
contexts: The lawyers will confer about the case.
The university conferred an honorary degree.

definition: to establish the truth or correctness of something
contexts: The test results confirmed our suspicions.
There's a conflict between the two departments.
The schedule conflicts with my meeting.

definition: to comply with rules or standards
contexts: Students must conform to the dress code.
The building conforms to safety regulations.
She gave her consent for the operation.

definition: following as a result or effect
contexts: The drought and consequent crop failure...
There was a consequent increase in prices.

definition: notably large in size, amount, or extent
contexts: There was considerable damage to the building.

definition: to be composed or made up of
contexts: The team consists of five members.
Breakfast consists of toast and coffee.
The machine makes a constant noise.

definition: to form or make up a whole

contexts: She felt constrained by the rules.

definition: to build or form by putting together parts
contexts: They will construct a new bridge.

definition: to seek information or advice from
contexts: She consulted the manual for instructions.

definition: to use up or eat and drink
contexts: Americans consume a lot of coffee.
The fire consumed the entire building.
Please contact me if you have questions.
We lost contact with the satellite.

definition: the circumstances that form the setting
contexts: You need to understand the context.
His words were taken out of context.
They signed a contract for the house.

definition: to deny the truth of a statement
to compare in order to show differences
contexts: The white walls contrast with the dark furniture.

definition: to give something to help achieve a result
contexts: Everyone should contribute to the discussion.

definition: a way things are usually done
contexts: It's a social convention to shake hands.
The convention will be held next week.

definition: to change the form or function of something
contexts: They converted the barn into a house.

definition: to persuade someone to do or believe something
contexts: She convinced me to join the club.

definition: to work together toward a common goal
contexts: Countries must cooperate on environmental issues.

definition: to organize different elements to work together
contexts: She coordinates all the marketing activities.
We need to coordinate our schedules.

definition: the central or most important part
contexts: This is the core of the problem.
Apple core should be thrown away.
The corporate headquarters is in New York.

definition: to have close similarity or to communicate
contexts: The results correspond to our predictions.
What are the criteria for admission?
She meets all the criteria for the job.

definition: the arts, customs, and habits of a society
contexts: The company has a strong corporate culture.

definition: money in any form when in actual use
contexts: The euro is the currency of many European countries.

definition: a series of events that repeat regularly
contexts: The water cycle is essential for life.
She cycles to work every day.

definition: system of methods used in research
combination of ideas to form a theory
amount by which expenses exceed income
use of living systems for technology
relating to or involving mental health
contexts: The mental health shows important characteristics.
This mental health demonstrates key principles.

definition: relating to or involving vice president
contexts: The vice president shows important characteristics.
This vice president demonstrates key principles.

definition: based on theory rather than practice
economic system based on private ownership
